name: places/ChIJ4U4r60VZwokRpXX16Pnukjk
formattedAddress: 465 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
adrFormatAddress: 465 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA

originalText.text: Do not recommend. I went in to the shop and was never acknowledged by the salesperson.  All of the signs stating “Do not touch” the merchandise are ridiculous.  The store clearly does not understand the psychology behind shopping and how touching and feeling items are crucial to the process.  Highly recommend going down the street to Magpie for cute gifts.

The store clearly does not understand the psychology behind shopping and how touching and feeling items are crucial to the process.  Highly recommend going down the street to Magpie for cute gifts.

originalText.text: Was interested in purchasing a bowl as a gift, and was chastised for touching a product when I never did. I explained I had not and was interested though if she could give me a price but was met with a rude curt response. I would not support this business, there are lots of other businesses in the area that treat their patrons better.

I explained I had not and was interested though if she could give me a price but was met with a rude curt response. I would not support this business, there are lots of other businesses in the area that treat their patrons better.

originalText.text: This place is offensively and comically terrible. I walked in with my wife and our 1 year old son strapped into a small stroller. We intended to purchase a bowl for my mother-in-law. The sales person rudely barked at us that we had to leave the stroller (and presumably the toddler in it) outside. When my wife tried to touch the bowl we wanted to purchase, the sales person condescendingly told us to “look at the sign” in the corner that says patrons aren’t allowed to touch any of the merchandise. Every aspect of her demeanor and behavior was rude and unwelcoming. To be clear, there is nothing special about the stuff they’re selling. It’s curated home goods. There are *so* many other stores both in this neighborhood and in the city more broadly that target this market, and they all have both better stock and service. I’m shocked this place continues to stay open. Will never return and suggest no one else patronize this awful establishment.

originalText.text: I received a gift for Chanukah and tried to return it before the holiday was even over.  Because it was past the 10 day return window, the owner wouldn't take back the item even though it is exclusively made for her store and is on backorder.  Don't support a business that isn't interested in building customer relationships.  Terrible customer service.  And items are way over priced.

originalText.text:
I have never had such a horrible experience.  I went in to exchange a gift which was a small bowl and a spoon.   the owner grudgingly took it.  Without even looking it up she stated that it was only $50. I didn’t see anything there for that amount.  While she was having a long conversation about her mice infestation I touched some items. I did not want to interfere with her mouse conversation. The person there admonished me for not reading her signs to not touch. When I asked her the price of a bowl she told me $120 even though it said $108.  When I pointed that out to her, she sold it to me for $108.  When I asked for a box for the bowl she refused.
Very nasty person.
